alert.note: Alert for Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 5:08AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Washington, southeastern Wayne and northeastern Greene Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 507 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over State Line, or 14 miles west of Chatom, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chatom, Wagarville, Tibbie, Calvert, State Line, Fruitdale and McIntosh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
